intro: Freycinetia sumatrana var. penangiana, commonly known as the Penang freycinetia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the palms family, Arecaceae, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched stem and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with inconspicuous flowers, followed by clustered, hard-shelled fruits. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a notable species in horticulture.
